did.abstract: One official document from 1850, written in Danish, granting Benjamin Brush the right to travel to Cuba from St. Thomas in the Virgin Islands.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single item.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Benjamin Harvey Brush (1820-1853), son of Joshua and Sarah (Ralph) Brush, was born in Smithtown, Long Island, N.Y.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Benjamin Brush passport, 1974.257, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Rehoused and finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One official document, written in Danish, granting Benjamin Brush the right to travel to Cuba from St. Thomas in the Virgin Islands. Stamped by the Danish government in St. Thomas. Dated 1850.
